about.title: About Jynx
about.subtitle: Transforming gaming from solo to social

story.title: Our Story
story.p1: Founded in 2024, Jynx was born from a simple yet powerful vision: to transform how gamers connect and play together. We understand the frustration of wasting precious gaming time searching for compatible teammates or struggling to find players who match your skill level and gaming style.
story.p2: Our platform serves as the bridge between solo gaming experiences and fulfilling team play, allowing you to quickly find your perfect gaming companions based on skill level, playing style, and personality.

problem.title: The Problem We're Solving
problem.intro: As gamers ourselves, we've experienced the challenges firsthand:

points.time: Spending more time searching for teammates than actually playing
points.mismatch: Getting matched with players whose skills or goals don't align with yours
points.disconnected: Feeling disconnected from the broader gaming community
points.relationships: Struggling to build lasting gaming relationships

problem.conclusion: Jynx addresses these pain points with innovative matchmaking systems designed specifically for gamers, by gamers.

arthur.name: Arthur Bonvallet
arthur.bio: A passionate gamer and experienced product specialist from Paris, Arthur brings his deep understanding of user experience and product development to Jynx. His vision drives our platform's intuitive design and feature set.

antoine.name: Antoine Haie
antoine.bio: Antoine's technical expertise as a fullstack developer powers the Jynx platform. Based in Paris, his gaming background combined with his technical skills ensures our platform delivers a seamless experience for gamers of all levels.

elo.title: ELO-Based Match Queue
elo.description: Our sophisticated matching algorithm considers your skill level (ELO) to connect you with teammates and opponents who provide the right level of challenge and compatibility.

chat.title: Global Chat System
chat.description: Stay connected with the broader gaming community through our vibrant global chat system, where you can discuss strategies, share experiences, or simply hang out with fellow gamers.

guilds.title: Guild-Based Communities
guilds.description: Find your gaming home with our unique "guild" system. Join existing communities based on your favorite games or playing styles, or create your own guild and become a community leader. Build your reputation, establish your team culture, and grow your network of gaming allies.

for_everyone.title: For Every Gamer
for_everyone.p1: Whether you're a casual player looking for fun companions or a competitive gamer seeking serious teammates for tournament play, Jynx welcomes all. Our platform supports communities across all game types, genres, and platforms.
for_everyone.p2: Don't see a community for your favorite game? Create one and become its founding leader! At Jynx, we believe in empowering gamers to build and nurture their own spaces.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.p1: Jynx is more than just a platformâ€”it's a growing community of gamers who believe that gaming is better together. We're just getting started, and we invite you to be part of our journey as we revolutionize how gamers connect, compete, and collaborate.

rights.title: 7. Your Rights (GDPR)
rights.intro: Under GDPR, you have the following rights:

access.title: 7.1. Right of Access
access.p1: You can request a copy of all data we hold about you.
access.how: How to exercise this right: Settings > Privacy > "Export My Data"
access.process: The process generates a JSON file containing all your data (profile, messages, statistics, etc.). The download link is valid for 7 days.

rectification.title: 7.2. Right of Rectification
rectification.p1: You can modify your profile information at any time from the application (username, bio, preferences, etc.).

erasure.title: 7.3. Right to Erasure ("Right to be Forgotten")
erasure.p1: You can request deletion of your account.
erasure.how: How to exercise this right: Settings > Danger Zone > "Delete My Account"

process.title: Automated Deletion Process:
process.step1: Two-step confirmation to prevent accidental deletions
process.step2: Immediate anonymization of your personal data (Firestore)
process.step3: Deletion of your Firebase Authentication account (automatically revokes all OAuth tokens)
process.step4: An anonymized ID is provided as reference
process.step5: Option to delete your messages and generated content

erasure.important: Important: Deletion is irreversible. Some anonymized data may be retained for statistical purposes (GDPR-compliant).
erasure.manual: Manual Deletion Requests: For specific data deletion requests (e.g., delete only messages from a specific community, delete Storage images, or other edge cases), please contact our Data Protection Officer at dpo@jynx.app. We will process manual requests within 30 days as required by GDPR.

portability.title: 7.4. Right to Data Portability
portability.p1: The data export (Section 7.1) allows you to retrieve your data in a structured, machine-readable format (JSON).

objection.title: 7.5. Right to Object
objection.p1: You can object to the processing of your data for direct marketing purposes.

withdraw.title: 7.6. Right to Withdraw Consent
withdraw.p1: You can withdraw your consent for:
withdraw.oauth: Note: OAuth tokens (Google, Apple) are automatically revoked when you delete your account (Section 7.3).

security.auth: Authentication: Secure session management via Firebase Auth
security.validation: Input Validation: XSS injection prevention via SecureTextInput
security.rate_limiting: Rate Limiting: Protection against abuse (spam messages, automated actions)
security.moderation: Moderation: Content reporting and moderation system
security.breach: No system is 100% secure. In case of a data breach, we will notify you in compliance with GDPR (within 72 hours).

international.title: 9. International Data Transfers
international.p1: Your data may be transferred and stored on servers located outside the European Union, including:
international.google: Google Cloud / Firebase: Uses global infrastructure with GDPR compliance
international.sentry: Sentry: US-based servers with Privacy Shield compliance
international.guarantees: Guarantees: All our partners offer protection guarantees equivalent to GDPR (standard contractual clauses, Privacy Shield certifications).

cookies.p1: Our mobile application does not use cookies in the traditional sense, but uses:
cookies.tokens: Authentication Tokens: Stored locally in a secure manner
cookies.cache: Local Cache: To improve performance (profile data, recent messages)

changes.title: 11. Changes to This Policy

contact.title: 12. Contact Us

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Gaming Matchmaking

q1.question: Is there a Tinder-like app for gamers to find teammates?
q1.answer:
If you're tired of randoms who rage quit, can't communicate in your language, or are online when you're asleep, Jynx let you filter for what actually matters: compatible schedules, similar skill levels, and shared gaming preferences. You swipe through potential teammates who meet your criteria, skip the awkward cold messaging, and only connect with players who are genuinely available when you want to play.

The difference from regular LFG forums or Discord servers? You're not shouting into the void hoping someone responds, you're seeing only people who already match your availability, speak your language, and play your games. Less time spamming "LFG" in chat, more time in-game with people you'll actually want to team up with again.

q2.question: How to meet gamers online and build a gaming friend group?
q2.answer:
The biggest challenge in meeting gamers isn't finding people, it's finding the RIGHT people. You need teammates who are available when you play, communicate in your language, and match your skill level.

Here's what actually works:
â€¢ Filter before you commit: Look for platforms where you can browse player profiles with verified stats, availability, and playstyle before connecting
â€¢ Prioritize compatibility: Timezone, rank, and communication style matter more than just playing the same game
â€¢ Build gradually: Focus on finding 2-3 solid teammates rather than joining huge communities where meaningful connections are harder to form

Avoid platforms that force you to spam "LFG" messages and hope for responses, your time is valuable.

q3.question: How to find teammates for ranked games in League of Legends and Valorant?
q3.answer:
Finding good ranked teammates isn't about quantity, it's about compatibility. Playing with randoms who don't communicate, rage quit after first blood, or play roles they're not comfortable with costs you LP and sanity.

What to look for in ranked teammates:
â€¢ Verified rank: Make sure they're actually at your ELO (not smurfing or boosted)
â€¢ Role compatibility: Check their champion pool and preferred roles before queuing
â€¢ Consistent availability: Ranked grinding requires regular play, find people with similar schedules
â€¢ Communication style: Some players prefer shotcalling, others want minimal chat. Match this upfront.

The best approach? Use platforms that verify player ranks through Riot's API and let you filter by role, schedule, and communication preferences. You'll spend less time in champ select dodging and more time climbing.

q4.question: What are the best alternatives to Discord for finding gaming teammates?
q4.answer:
Discord is great for chatting with teammates you ALREADY have, but terrible for finding new ones. Here's why:

Posting "LFG" in a server with 10,000 members means your message gets buried in minutes. You have no way to filter by skill level, availability, or playstyle before reaching out. And most importantly, you're doing all the work, spamming channels, DMing strangers, hoping someone responds.

What you actually need is a platform designed for discovery, not just communication:
â€¢ Player profiles: See someone's rank, schedule, and preferred roles BEFORE messaging
â€¢ Smart filtering: Search by criteria that matter (language, timezone, skill level)
â€¢ Active matching: Get recommendations instead of shouting into the void

The goal isn't to replace Discord, it's to use the right tool for discovery, then move to Discord for voice chat once you've found compatible teammates.

q5.question: Are there free gaming matchmaking apps and platforms?
q5.answer:
Yes, and you shouldn't have to pay just to find teammates. Many platforms offer robust free tiers that include the essentials: player discovery, profile browsing, chat, and session planning.

What to expect from free tiers:
â€¢ Core matchmaking features (search, filter, connect)
â€¢ Player profiles with stats
â€¢ Basic messaging and session scheduling

What premium tiers usually add:
â€¢ Unlimited daily matches/swipes
â€¢ Advanced filters (very specific criteria)
â€¢ Cosmetic upgrades (badges, profile customization)

Red flags to avoid:
â€¢ Paywalling basic features like messaging or seeing who matched with you
â€¢ Forcing you to pay to verify your rank or link accounts
â€¢ No free tier at all (if they're confident in the product, they should let you try it)

Your time is more valuable than subscription fees, focus on platforms with generous free tiers so you can test before committing.
